results.title: The Sugar disease
results.brief_description: This film looks at the problem of diabetes, its origins and the research going on to discover its causes. In addition, four well-known people who are diabetics talk about themselves and their lives as diabetics. Canadian scientist, Dr Best, recalls his involvement in the discovery of insulin in 1921.

results.title: The Stylist
results.creator_credit: Lewis Jacobs, Joseph March and MPO Productions
results.brief_description: Reveals the automobile designer, working behind guarded doors to style the “dream cars” for the following year, and the more distant future. Endeavours to explain pictorially the process by which the stylist finds inspiration for new body designs to charm the customer. Prologue spoken by William Clay Ford, vice president of Ford Motor Co. Music by Sol Kaplan. Cinematography by Stan Meredith. Narrated by Shepperd Strudwick.

results.title: The Stunt woman [Dubbed version]
results.creator_credit: Ann Hui, Catherine Hun, David Lau, Daca Entertainment and Golden Bowl
results.brief_description: Ah Kam (Michelle Yeoh) is a stuntwoman trying to break into the male dominated arena of the martial art movie. A fearless perfectionist, intent on making her mark and earning the respect of her peers, she teams with a director known as ‘The Chief’ with whom she forms a professional and personal bond. On his latest flick The Chief is working against a tight deadline and places his stunt crew in jeopardy in order to get the job done. Kam displays a loyalty to The Chief that compromises her wellbeing as she performs some terrifying stunts whilst injured. Several subplots involve bar room brawling, the Hong Kong triads, after hours carousing and romance for Kam with a duplicitous playboy. Yeoh is convincing as Kam, a woman with ambition and determination to make it in a tough arena whilst displaying a familial loyalty to her colleagues. The film is an interesting behind the scenes look at the making of martial arts movies and the danger of injury that hangs over career stunt men and women. Yeoh was seriously injured during one stunt, jumping from a bridge, the footage of which is screened under the end credits. Dubbed version in English.

results.title: The Stuff we throw away
results.creator_credit: Stuart Finley and Stuart Finley Productions
results.brief_description: Relates how innovative demonstration grants and research activities being developed by the Bureau of Solid Waste Management in association with local communities can develop new and better systems for solid waste disposal. Methods include a pollution free incinerator, and “Mount Trashmore” built of above-grade sanitary landfill.
results.description: Relates how innovative demonstration grants and research activities being developed by the Bureau of Solid Waste Management in association with local communities can develop new and better systems for solid waste disposal. results.title: The Studio workshop
results.creator_credit: George Lewin and Triton Manufacturing and Design Company
results.brief_description: This comprehensive two cassette programme provides the home improver with a step by step guide how to plan and build a studio workshop. Hosted by George Lewin, inventor of the Triton Workcentre, the video provides dozens of labour saving tips, and makes effective use of computer generated graphics to clarify techniques and principles. Tape one covers site preparation, laying foundations, bricklaying, wall and roof framing. Tape two covers wall and roof cladding, windows and doors, as well as fitout.

results.title: The Studio
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Explains how the studio setting allows the photographer maximum control of all the elements of the photograph. Jerry Abramowits, a “product photographer”, shows the photographer’s responsibilities in a typical advertising assignment, while Sandi Fellman discusses the world of fashion photography.

results.title: The Students (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Anthony Cash, Roger Owen and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Teaching Adults”
This program looks briefly at the “consumers” of voluntary adult education. It stresses the variety of courses they pursue and especially their own diversity. An adult class is not homogeneous, there are varieties in age, educational background, experience and social class. In many situations (notably craft classes) this tends to lead to individual teaching (which can be uneconomical in terms of the use of a teacher’s time).

results.title: The Structure of protein
results.creator_credit: John Armstrong, George Seager, De La Cheura Films and Unilever Films
results.brief_description: Describes the composition of an amino acid and shows how these acids form polypeptide chains of which proteins are composed. Briefly discusses the techniques used to determine the precise structure of a protein.
